sources.title: The Lady Vanishes (1938)
sources.description: A DAMA OCULTA (The Lady Vanishes, 1938) ( Filme Completo / Legendado em Português ) Data de Lançamento:  11 de Outubro de 1935 » SOBRE O FILME: Em um pequeno recanto da Europa os passageiros de um trem ficam retidos em virtude de uma nevasca e são obrigados a pernoitar em uma pequena estalagem. Lá uma rica jovem conhece uma velha governanta e ambas combinam de se encontrarem no dia seguinte no trem. Entretanto, logo após o início da viagem a governanta desaparece e ninguém, por motivos diversos, afirma ter visto a pessoa desaparecida. Ela persiste em suas investigações e acaba convencendo um musicólogo, com quem ela tinha se desentendido na véspera. » » DIREÇÃO:  Alfred Hitchcock GÊNERO: Comédia, Romance, Suspense ORIGEM: Reino Unido  DURAÇÃO: 96 minutos » » ELENCO PRINCIPAL:  Margaret Lockwood: Iris Henderson  Michael Redgrave: Gilbert  Paul Lukas: Dr. Hartz  Dame May Whitty: Miss Froy  Cecil Parker: Sr. Todhunter  Linden Travers: Sra. Todhunter  Naunton Wayne: Caldicott  Basil Radford: Charters  Mary Clare: Baronesa  Josephine Wilson: Madame Kummer  Alfred Hitchcock: Homem na estação  Googie Withers: Blanche

sources.title: The Lady Vanishes (1938) The Film That Made ALFRED HITCHCOCK "The Master of Suspense"!
sources.description:
English tourist Iris Henderson boards a train home after a trip to Bandrika, but the journey takes a sinister turn when a kind governess, Miss Froy, mysteriously vanishes. With the help of fellow passenger Gilbert Redman, Iris uncovers a web of deceit involving spies, a bandaged patient, and a dangerous conspiracy. As the pair fight to uncover the truth, they must deliver a vital message hidden in a simple tune—Miss Froy's final secret.

Black & White version: https://youtu.be/jQ9ICZjQaLM


Director: Alfred Hitchcock
Writers: Sidney Gilliat & Frank Launder adapted "The Wheel Spins" by Ethel Lina White
Stars: Margaret Lockwood, Michael Redgrave, Paul Lukas
Genres: Colorized, Mystery, Thriller, Literary
Release date: October 7, 1938 (London)


00:00 – Full Movie with subtitles
01:30 – Iris Henderson and fellow passengers are stranded at a hotel due to an avalanche.
15:45 – Iris meets Miss Froy, an elderly governess, at the hotel.
25:30 – A flowerpot falls, hitting Iris on the head as she boards the train.
35:20 – Miss Froy mysteriously disappears from the moving train.
50:10 – Iris and Gilbert discover Miss Froy's glasses in the baggage car.
1:05:00 – Dr. Hartz reveals his involvement in the conspiracy and attempts to drug Iris and Gilbert.
1:20:15 – A gunfight ensues between the passengers and soldiers after the train is diverted.
1:30:00 – Miss Froy escapes into the forest after entrusting a secret tune to Iris and Gilbert.


@CultCinemaClassics 

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdYk5RxyogiPKX8L3kakHq-B

sources.title: 1938 - The Lady Vanishes - Alarma en el expreso - Alfred Hitchcock - VOSE

metadata.Plot: Passengers on a scheduled train out of the mountainous European country of Mandrika are delayed by a day due to an avalanche, and thus get up close and personal with each other out of necessity in the only and what becomes an overcrowded inn in the area. Once the train departs, the one person who it is uncertain is on the train is a middle aged English governess named Miss Froy (Dame May Whitty). Iris Henderson (Margaret Lockwood), who was vacationing in Mandrika with girlfriends before heading back to England to get married, is certain that Miss Froy was on the train as they were in the same compartment and they had tea together in the dining car, but all those people who can corroborate her story don't seem to want to do so. Iris' thoughts are easily dismissed as a possible concussion as Iris was hit over the head just before boarding the train. Iris will take anyone's help in finding Miss Froy, even that of an Englishman named Gilbert (Sir Michael Redgrave), a musicologist with whom she had a not so pleasant encounter at the inn the evening before. As Iris and Gilbert go on their quest throughout the train, they believe there is a conspiracy amongst many of the passengers against the validity of there being a Miss Froy. But if there is a conspiracy, Iris and Gilbert still have to find Miss Froy and find out why anyone would want to kidnap a middle aged English governess.
metadata.Writer: Ethel Lina White, Sidney Gilliat, Frank Launder
metadata.Actors: Margaret Lockwood, Michael Redgrave, Paul Lukas
